headers.subject: Re: Newbee - How to test?
headers.received: from 172.17.201.92 by 13g2000cwe.googlegroups.com with HTTP; Wed, 24 Jan 2007 19:47:46 +0000 (UTC)
headers.x-http-useragent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.0.9) Gecko/20061211 SeaMonkey/1.0.7,gzip(gfe),gzip(gfe)

body.para: You can use the dry run flag to see a server response without adding an item to the snippets index. The flag is documented here: http://code.google.com/apis/base/items-feed.html and it is used as a URL parameter. Try adding dry-run=true to the URL when insert and query your items feed.

quote.quotepara: I am new to this so please excuse if I did not catch this elsewhere. I want to use the Base API from within our app (c#) to add, update and delete records in the housing item area. As a developer I am use to running my code and seeing the outcome. As I understand what I have read so far is it takes a day before something appears in the regular search. What I would really like is to see my items not even in a regular search but on a test server that I can code against to learn and understand what I need to do. Can I do this? Can I use "play" data without actually having other see?
